name.value: FHIR Connectathon 15 - Patient - Formal Testing - FHIR Client - Version Read - XML

description.value: Patient Track - Formal Testing - tests external FHIR Client and Server to version read a XML formatted Patient with minimum data elements: identifier, name.family, name.given, gender and birthDate. The origin and destination systems must support the vread operation.
Enter the patient FHIR resource id the origin system will send to the destination system.
Enter the patient FHIR version id the origin system will send to the destination system.
Version Read an existing patient using XML. The expected response content is the requested version of the Patient resource in XML format.
Version Read (vread) the requested version of the Patient and verify the contents.
Confirm that the client requested an Accept of the FHIR XML mime type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the client did not request a Content-Type. Warning only as the client may send this by default.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the resource version is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned resource contains an identifier element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains a family name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains a given name element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains a gender element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
Confirm that the returned resource contains a birthDate element and value. Warning only to provide users with reviewable results.
